docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
• pip install mkdocs - Install mkdocs.
  • pip install mkdocs-material - Install mkdocs-material for the fonts.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Hosting the site
docs.text:
To host the site there are different alternatives:

  • Public Repo:
    • GitHub Pages (free)
  • Private:
    • Another hosting provider (e.g., Netifly)
    • GitHub Enterprise

docs.title: Hosting the site with GitHub Pages
docs.text:
(Having the Repo initialized/cloned) Using the terminal create a new documentation project: mkdocs new test_docu

Mkdocs will create: 

mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.

Deploy the site in GitHub Pages using the following command in the terminal: mkdocs gh-deploy
